alert.note: Alert for Menifee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 6:55PM EDT until September 04 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following county, Menifee. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Frenchburg, Mariba, Ratlitt and Scranton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
